body:
I'll just note that this is mentioned in the FAQ https://rclone.org/faq/#rclone-is-using-too-much-memory-or-appears-to-have-a-memory-leak

And also that I'm scheduled to implement an out of memory sync later this year which will fix the problem properly.
@zackees very articulate post, thank you for raising the large scale experiment issue.

rename.from: For those seeing rclone eating up GIGS OF MEMORY, READ THIS
rename.to: Excess memory use when syncing millions of files in one directory

body:
I forgot to say there is a workaround for this written up in the wiki

- https://github.com/rclone/rclone/wiki/Big-syncs-with-millions-of-files

Which came from this forum post originally

- https://forum.rclone.org/t/rclone-sync-s3-to-s3-runs-for-hours-and-copy-nothing/39687/23

It isn't the best solution, but it will work until the out of memory sync is in.

@ncw is there any workround for this issue. Because I have 50 million objects in single directory. Also I tried the way of sorting it. Almost I have waited for 2 hours, still the sorting is not completed.

@ncw yes it worked ! Took Almost two and half hours. Now I can able to chunk and sync it.

Below is the  automated script to split and sync

#!/bin/bash

# Step 1: Split the list into chunks of 10,000 lines each
split -l 10000 need-to-transfer transfer_chunk_

# Step 2: Process each chunk with rclone
for chunk in transfer_chunk_*
do
    echo "Processing $chunk"
    # Perform the sync operation for this chunk
    rclone copy src:bucket dst:bucket --files-from $chunk --no-traverse
done

# Step 3: Log completion
echo "All chunks processed."

> I forgot to say there is a workaround for this written up in the wiki
> 
>     * https://github.com/rclone/rclone/wiki/Big-syncs-with-millions-of-files
> 
> 
> Which came from this forum post originally
> 
>     * https://forum.rclone.org/t/rclone-sync-s3-to-s3-runs-for-hours-and-copy-nothing/39687/23
> 
> 
> It isn't the best solution, but it will work until the out of memory sync is in.

Is there a way to make that solution take in to account changed files? Not sure if there is a good way to do that

If anyone would like to try the solution to this, here is rclone with an out of memory sync for directories with lots of entries. This should fix the memory usage problems.

Testing appreciated :-)

[v1.69.0-beta.8480.59a5530ce.fix-7974-out-of-memory-sync](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7974-out-of-memory-sync/v1.69.0-beta.8480.59a5530ce.fix-7974-out-of-memory-sync/) on branch [fix-7974-out-of-memory-sync](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-7974-out-of-memory-sync) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I just tried this new version and it's working perfectly. The sync has been running for almost 2 hours and it has replicated 850k / 5M without an issue.

With the version v1.69 it was always crashing on OOM. üëè
Thanks, ill try this this week, i have exactly this problem

I installed the binary and ran dedupe. Machine ran out of memory. Not sure if this patch has been applied to this tool. I have yet to run this on sync.

The machine in question was 2GB.
